meanings.definition: To lie in warmth or sunlight, especially for pleasure or relaxation.
meanings.sent1: The cat loves to bask in the sun on the windowsill.
meanings.sent2: I like to bask in the warmth of a cozy blanket on a cold day.
meanings.sent3: The lizard decided to bask in the sun, feeling like a little king of the rock.
meanings.sent4: As the flowers basked in the sunlight, they seemed to bloom even brighter.
meanings.sent5: The old dog would bask in the sun, his fur glowing golden in the light.

meanings.definition: To take great pleasure or satisfaction in something.
meanings.sent1: She would bask in the joy of finishing a good book.
meanings.sent2: The children basked in the happiness of playing together all day.
meanings.sent3: He would bask in the victory of winning the game, a big smile on his face.
meanings.sent4: The artist would bask in the colors of his masterpiece, feeling truly content.
meanings.sent5: The singer would bask in the applause of the audience, her heart full of pride.
